document.title: Physical Education Model Content Standards for California Public Schools Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

2FE257FA06AB4F38B81340C32780EF62.description: Encourage others to be supportive and inclusive of individuals of all ability levels.

8983DCD38E7544138776F9F914E6CC1D.description:
Identify leadership skills, perform planned leadership assignments, and assume
spontaneous leadership roles.

9A2DF6E18302464EA21A33AD798736AE.description:
Explain how to select and modify physical activities to allow for participation by younger
children, the elderly, and individuals with special needs.

54F2A8515E484F8781060CE554DFF90D.description:
Identify the effects of individual differences, such as age, gender, ethnicity, socioeconomic
status, and culture, on preferences for and participation in physical activity.

ACBB641B7E2941FB9EF33984B1A5A883.description: Evaluate and refine personal goals to improve performance in physical activities.

70D72A3BA1D343A39CBB6A3CB27F11C7.description: Explain and analyze the role of individual attitude, motivation, and determination in achieving personal satisfaction from challenging physical activities.

1808662A3074433CB30D325667825EB8.description: Evaluate the psychological benefits derived from regular participation in physical activity.

29C068CA99E34D39B9417374AEC9FD3D.description: Examine and explain the ways in which personal characteristics, performance styles, and preferences for activities may change over a lifetime.

05614DEAEA9D450F96EC621AD08CADB3.description: Participate in physical activities for personal enjoyment.

034067D81B614C82BDEDF3C2F3DFC8F2.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of psychological and sociological
concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the learning and
performance of physical activity.

23E0345AB1484BF08E660E7021BC0407.description:
Use and analyze scientifically based data and protocols to assess oneself on the five
components of health-related physical fitness.

28B02093FBDA4C95908E07983C36E42F.description: Evaluate the availability and quality of fitness resources in the community.

FA29E46F1C014C6EBC933B5CD9976C52.description: Identify and evaluate ergogenic aids that claim to enhance body composition, appearance, physical fitness, and performance.

8EB7C9CDAAC147EE8BE2F038ED5D3516.description: Explain how to evaluate consumer physical fitness products and programs.

6D277A9A7BF34B71BC7265F46DC94643.description: Develop and implement an appropriate personal physical fitness program for a family or community member.

9DEFADA77D734D90B5B00142C07189FD.description: Develop and describe a physical fitness plan that enhances personal health and performance in future leisure and workplace activities.

B6763271FA0D49689E55D639E5639E36.description: Justify the use of particular physical activities to achieve desired fitness goals.

A530D53F1FFF4D2F8E68A772AF3B5605.description: Assess levels of physical fitness and adjust physical activity to accommodate changes in age, growth, and development.

AAF497EF3D4544FA9213445930787F70.description:
Identify and achieve levels of excellence in physical fitness that enhance physical and
mental performance beyond the standards established by scientifically based health-related fitness assessments.

3560701667694873AED4E3D152BE0135.description: Participate in challenging physical fitness activities using the principles of exercise to meet individual needs and interests.

1029F9318D344B4DB75EA6AF3A85CBC1.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity at least four days each week.

E0FC243AF97A495D8F1EFF65A28DE3C0.description:
Students achieve a level of physical fitness for health and performance while demonstrating knowledge of fitness concepts, principles, and
strategies.

B6A168964E25410787456B9E978C034C.description: Evaluate independent learning of movement skills.

E0E833D1E345498F9D8063CD4CCBF83D.description:
Assess the effect/outcome of a particular performance strategy used in combative,
gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities.

06B5A64A595B477DA4A2D37651B9F918.description: Analyze situations to determine appropriate strategies to use in combative, gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities.

A207B814C41F44F7B18BF7D169F20129.description: Create or modify practice/training plans based on evaluative feedback from skill acquisition and performance in combative, gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities.

77D3127B22BC4564AAC94B6AD826DF22.description: Analyze and explain which training and conditioning practices have the greatest impact on skill acquisition and performance in combative, gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities.

41EE7A9F64034A48AD2C98AE797504C7.description:
Analyze and evaluate feedback from proprioception, from others, and from the performance of complex motor (movement) activities to improve performance in combative,
gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities.

122F3308E302427AADFE6EE8CDE9148C.description: Evaluate the relationships of physical, emotional, and cognitive factors affecting individual and team performance.

A6F0E7D5967E45DF83620D1548D0C9E7.description:
Explain the use of the principles of biomechanics (leverage, force, inertia, rotary motion, and opposition); apply the principles to achieve advanced performance in combative,
gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities; and evaluate the performance based on use of the principles.

5839457C211748E882EF62953C5C265E.description:
Explain and demonstrate advanced offensive, defensive, and transition strategies and
tactics in combative, gymnastic/tumbling, and team activities.

0639E62B3F21433EAFD3E574ADD0A836.description:
Explain the skill-related components of balance, reaction time, agility, coordination,
explosive power, and speed that enhance performance levels in combative, gymnastic/
tumbling, and team activities and apply those components in performance.

614C81B4FECB43A59EAC5437A9751B3E.description:
Demonstrate proficient movement skills in combative, gymnastic/tumbling, and team
activities.

373D726D1C8548E6873015B5D314B78C.description:
Combine and apply movement patterns, from simple to complex, in combative, gym-
nastic/tumbling, and team activities.

CAB2594E884C4AA7B982537491470C24.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of and competency in motor skills, movement patterns, and strategies needed to perform a variety of
physical activities.

6DA57AB48051476D9FF663884937A090.description: Identify and utilize the potential strengths of each individual in physical activities.

22ADDB4817264F7EB0522978082725CF.description: Recognize and evaluate the role of cooperation and positive interactions with others when participating in physical activity.

79035A4DFE30488E8B098907E35E8371.description: Recognize the value of physical activity in understanding multiculturalism.

5AEEE992B5B1459F8511998E4D272B7E.description:
Analyze the role that physical activity plays in social interaction and cooperative
opportunities in the family and the workplace.

3CF515AA87B144C48C139D5FEDC0997B.description: Discuss the changing psychological and sociological needs of a diverse society in relation to physical activity.

B6A63B0BB076431BB840E2223671B13A.description: Develop personal goals to improve one’s performance in physical activities.

8012BA8D901E40BB9E401CC5A233F895.description: Describe the enjoyment, self-expression, challenge, and social benefits experienced by achieving one’s best in physical activities.

2F12E24318584EE982E4E64DBEDF67DA.description: Identify and evaluate personal psychological responses to physical activity.

5EB1F46FF4244385A875BA2B7CEB017F.description: Act independently of negative peer pressure during physical activity.

54DB80F6773C44E68356A693E8CF59B9.description: Accept personal responsibility to create and maintain a physically and emotionally safe and nonthreatening environment for physical activity.

1B005C66CDB84E44A789AFB952656ED6.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of psychological and sociological
concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the learning and
performance of physical activity.

CFD260CCA2A343BC83E49C9B968197BA.description: Explain the role of physical activity in the prevention of disease and the reduction of health care costs.

8644149F34F245229ECDEA3717E1B41A.description: Identify and list available fitness resources in the community.

EDDD31531C854EC1A52A7430A4E06940.description: Explain the inherent risks associated with physical activity in extreme environments.

45D9785AC2FE40A08013BB3BBF318024.description: Analyze consumer physical fitness products and programs.

685C134DEAAF4A438E9C8EE61501CE14.description: Develop and implement a one-month personal physical fitness plan.

12831EAA5FA84DF483C6B6FAA7AF32F7.description: Identify the physical fitness requirements of an occupation.

0F92BD7E67294B259B191C09CF73E12D.description:
Improve and maintain physical fitness by adjusting physical activity levels according to
the principles of exercise.

B5F9345351C54CA6B86DB380A226BCE7.description: Use physical fitness test results to set and adjust goals to improve fitness.

9AF8299228BF4C2C8DCBF179AD037FA2.description: Meet health-related physical fitness standards established by a scientifically based health-related fitness assessment.

E1D513C47E7744B781CA7D2EFA8DECBC.description: Participate in enjoyable and challenging physical activities that develop and maintain the five components of physical fitness.

A24C57DFA9FA4B5792C70A092AFAC4CE.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity at least four days each week.

D1AFC592D6394EEE90C8C50807274188.description:
Students achieve a level of physical fitness for health and performance while demonstrating knowledge of fitness concepts, principles, and
strategies.

167C75482A0B448A8BA51E85EEB7D8E1.description: Demonstrate independent learning of movement skills.

63B91D694822483490F8EE26703A11EB.description: Assess the effect/outcome of a particular performance strategy in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

E9F1791EEFA746D294EEC5258F446684.description: Analyze situations and determine appropriate strategies for improved performance in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

69308450D5DC4D58867EE51E76ECAD87.description: Create or modify practice/training plans based on evaluative feedback of skill acquisition and performance in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

95BE4139B50545A6B7C768220D8F8A9D.description: Analyze and explain which training and conditioning practices have the greatest impact on skill acquisition and performance in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

FC48881F5433425E83C7045DF2552689.description: Analyze and evaluate feedback from proprioception, from others, and from the performance of complex motor (movement) activities to improve performance in aquatic, rhythms/dance, individual activities, and dual activities.

A9F28EE584A24D7F8559B36A2B24BBFA.description: Examine the physical, emotional, cognitive, and scientific factors that affect performance a nd explain the relationship between those factors.

3B26BD6CEBD841288A270938D71E16AA.description: Explain the use of the principles of biomechanics (leverage, force, inertia, rotary motion, opposition, and buoyancy); apply the principles to achieve advanced performance in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities; and evaluate the performance based on the use of the principles.

12FE3DC6ACAE4D47A1074A51BF604085.description:
Explain and demonstrate advanced offensive, defensive, and transition strategies in
aquatic and individual and dual activities.

36375C7724E841C39DA1527F76F40CB1.description: Identify, explain, and apply the skill-related components of balance, reaction time, agility, coordination, explosive power, and speed that enhance performance levels in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

EF084AA7429C448CA955944DE391995B.description: Demonstrate proficient movement skills in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

3751590EB0DA44BA96A09C2F90739B6F.description: Combine and apply movement patterns, simple to complex, in aquatic, rhythms/dance, and individual and dual activities.

29271434D17E460692CD572EF474B49D.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of and competency in motor skills, movement patterns, and strategies needed to perform a variety of
physical activities.

E16760FB68C649D3BD048D8782DF03AB.description:
Model support toward individuals of all ability levels and encourage others to be
supportive and inclusive of all individuals.

4F337705A68E43CD9CA9142E542AAE9E.description: Describe leadership roles and responsibilities in the context of team games and activities.

3A4C6AA8A0D8421D983EDB4BC9AE5627.description: Accept the roles of group members within the structure of a game or activity.

1C43DB60CEAE449A98A6DF950A1C18D9.description:
Identify the contributions of members of a group or team and reward members for
accomplishing a task or goal.

05A304A2A7EB47B8A59B603412418F6A.description: Identify and evaluate three preferences for lifelong physical activity and determine one’s responsibility for developing skills, acquiring knowledge of concepts, and achieving fitness.

FCABEF08870E480D8C4AB249589EC843.description: Organize and work cooperatively with a group to achieve the goals of the group.

48CDE675FE7A43E9AB80FC66583534B6.description:
Abide by the decisions of the officials, accept the outcome of the game, and show
appreciation toward participants.

932EE81C53AE4DE281E76F47C6526379.description:
Students demonstrate and utilize knowledge of psychological and
sociological concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the
learning and performance of physical activity.

FF8C2596E7DA4DB8B5275ED09337D9D1.description: Explain the different types of conditioning for different physical activities.

FB5586A1214D49E188658DA97B503412.description:
Explain the effects of nutrition and participation in physical activity on weight control,
self-concept, and physical performance.

F24E112292C648FB9FBABB9BFF12687C.description: Identify and apply basic principles in weight/resistance training and safety practices.

B8610C88795B4495BB8519B061351A80.description: Identify ways of increasing physical activity in routine daily activities.

EF154B7CF8E64483880713DF122FDAA5.description:
Identify appropriate physical activities that can be performed if one’s physical fitness
program is disrupted by inclement weather, travel from home or school, or a minor injury.

6FF2DA02BFED43CFB272023D5DAEAC5B.description:
Develop a two-week personal physical fitness plan specifying the proper warm-up and
cool-down activities and the principles of exercise for each of the five components of healthrelated
physical fitness.

581F8672DCE94D1690B8697A4CCAF7B7.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of physical fitness concepts,
principles, and strategies to improve health and performance.

9B115E17E8224C4E9E1566A360263474.description:
Participate safely in moderate to vigorous physical activity when conditions are atypical
(weather, travel, injury).

3E9D03A5439C4EA9A2A0E53541F9C259.description:
Assess periodically the attainment of, or progress toward, personal physical fitness goals
and make necessary adjustments to a personal physical fitness program.

04EA527114B64AB5AF27CD9F22549646.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity a minimum of four days each week.

86F0580CACC044F697C59A073BA52A2F.description:
Plan and implement a two-week personal physical fitness plan in collaboration with the
teacher.

414A8CC2DB274EC5AF95FEE5CEF1EFA7.description:
Refine individual personal physical fitness goals for each of the five components of healthrelated
physical fitness, using research-based criteria.

1D78FBF17F2D48BA828805DE04D79CD0.description:
Assess the components of health-related physical fitness (muscle strength, muscle endurance,
aerobic capacity, flexibility, and body composition) by using a scientifically based
health-related physical fitness assessment.

AEBBBB99332B43F7AC86A8345725711F.description:
Students assess and maintain a level of physical fitness to improve
health and performance.

E1F8066E24F14E1F9D65779FFB3B04D8.description:
Develop and teach a team game that uses elements of spin or rebound, designated
offensive and defensive space, a penalty system, and a scoring system.

B45CD1B799C94B74BB79273CF78A89F3.description:
Diagram, explain, and justify offensive and defensive strategies in modified and team
sports, games, and activities.

6417751FE8EC4BCBB7B3AA7AE0BB81C1.description:
Identify the characteristics of a highly skilled performance for the purpose of improving
one’s own performance.

DA8A242EA55549548444A39FE9EF1121.description:
Explain how growth in height and weight affects performance and influences the selection
of developmentally appropriate physical activities.

73A6A7598CFA447D938CDEDBD5B9A435.description: Explain the rotation principles used in performing various manipulative skills.

8698DE26CD4D4CDBBF1A7D1DCD450744.description:
Describe and demonstrate how movement skills learned in one physical activity can be
transferred and used to help learn another physical activity.

7B9990D540DC4DD5BF9FC0CC911271F3.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of movement concepts, principles,
and strategies that apply to the learning and performance of physical
activities.

800BEEF906A64BE1A88003986C6F3B59.description:
Create and perform a routine using fundamental gymnastic/tumbling skills, locomotor
and nonlocomotor movement patterns, and the elements of speed, direction, and level.

4FB65F85A8DF4F0FB9E8576861290C9D.description: Apply locomotor, nonlocomotor, and manipulative skills to team physical activities.

4B40CC10970346B8B2586A4C5885FF78.description: Demonstrate basic offensive and defensive skills and strategies in team physical activities.

0884038AF96746E485008F8898579ED3.description: Create and perform a square dance.

3DACD6A5150C4FA49317078EF0F53452.description: Identify and demonstrate square dance steps, positions, and patterns set to music.

1052A042B6D94A2CB6448296ED74BBA4.description:
Students demonstrate the motor skills and movement patterns needed
to perform a variety of physical activities.

57047E51EB894F06A20C5BF66F614A7E.description: Identify the responsibilities of a leader in physical activity.

095FF772CD284C1CB2AC35850B537A48.description:
Evaluate the effect of expressing encouragement to others while participating in a group
physical activity.

1375CD2FD3C040E6B94F7C8872D15C9E.description:
Demonstrate an acceptance of differences in physical development and personal
preferences as they affect participation in physical activity.

E004D92902A7452DBBD58FD62622F585.description:
Identify appropriate and inappropriate risks involved in adventure, individual, and dual
physical activities.

AF7D93D6B6BB47FA93D285E54BD9F61C.description:
Students demonstrate and utilize knowledge of psychological and
sociological concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the
learning and performance of physical activity.

1024F481B7CD4F6E844297E29E0E298F.description: Discuss the effect of extremity growth rates on physical fitness.

C76B0AD1559246389C716491ACACFDB8.description: Explain progression, overload, and specificity as principles of exercise.

DE89E8DE73A44830BB0E40330C596970.description: Identify and apply the principles of overload in safe, age-appropriate activities.

E5EB00D209D44FDD8B115B9C24EA4F31.description: Describe the role of physical activity and nutrition in achieving physical fitness.

07A5CEF0D1654CB291D0356AFBC15BA2.description: Explain the effects of physical activity on heart rate during exercise, during the recovery phase, and while the body is at rest.

E1FBA50E95E94B79B0535D721DCBBC1F.description: Match personal preferences in physical activities with each of the five components of health-related physical fitness.

DF101E20FAE1437CB514B5254A18AC91.description:
Identify physical activities that are effective in improving each of the health-related
physical fitness components.

4A6D4CAFCB2841B7B517E61EC323BD0C.description: Develop a one-week personal physical fitness plan specifying the proper warm-up and cool-down activities and the principles of exercise for each component of health-related physical fitness.

80B66AF05D9B4CAAA95AB12D3B25B717.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of physical fitness concepts,
principles, and strategies to improve health and performance.

B4168ED1F71644FBAE0FDF18B46102F4.description: Assess periodically the attainment of, or progress toward, personal physical fitness goals and make necessary adjustments to a personal physical fitness program.

79E0D612BBC14D3CADE32053C61111FD.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity a minimum of four days each week.

5B11E436E12B456E9C114B00433C1EB8.description: Plan a weekly personal physical fitness program in collaboration with the teacher.

6BFF1A22F4AB495FB65C88E300B4B2E0.description: Develop individual goals, from research-based standards, for each of the five components of health-related physical fitness.

A8B4E3A66F2442CD80F57EB895B58A37.description:
Evaluate individual measures of physical fitness in relationship to patterns of physical
activity.

F2EDED7A732E4C4AB40E820443DCF7F1.description:
Assess one’s own muscle strength, muscle endurance, aerobic capacity, flexibility, and
body composition by using a scientifically based health-related fitness assessment.

09FFE244BE854EE18B4637FB3B3D6225.description:
Students assess and maintain a level of physical fitness to improve
health and performance.

4D79A63CDB7E4CB3B30D1D4C9DB3790D.description: Develop an individual or dual game that uses a manipulative skill, two different offensive strategies, and a scoring system and teach it to another person.

C36EDCA912984D4E98F3037BBA06456A.description: Diagram and demonstrate basic offensive and defensive strategies for individual and dual physical activities.

667DB5709C3640A1B638DB0C12D26E6A.description: Compare and contrast the effectiveness of practicing skills as a whole and practicing skills in smaller parts.

BC16723C06D345059CD2754A7C166B76.description: Explain and demonstrate spin and rebound principles for performing manipulative skills.

230EB36C41224226AF4AAE6C586ED278.description:
Use principles of motor learning to establish, monitor, and meet goals for motor skill
development.

BCEEBA1F981A4954990CC47FCC8DFEFE.description: Analyze movement patterns and correct errors.

7B593F6A6FD844629D0B8C1F64386A5B.description: Identify and describe key elements in the mature performance of overhand, sidearm, and underhand throwing; catching; kicking/punting; striking; trapping; dribbling (hand and foot); and volleying.

441B074EC00E47B79E3B83C583304E3B.description:
Students demonstrate knowledge of movement concepts, principles,
and strategies that apply to the learning and performance of physical
activities.

DC4110D8BEC84431B06B1DA75E6B7EA6.description:
Demonstrate body management and object-manipulation skills needed for successful
participation in introductory adventure/outdoor activities.

7C66036380C74AB6A7296F4FB334B0CB.description:
Demonstrate body management and locomotor skills needed for successful participation
in track and field and combative activities.

A09B2D69CA494ED68571F43A83036CB1.description:
Demonstrate body management and object-manipulation skills needed for successful
participation in individual and dual physical activities.

E9507F39ED934E34A9821FD125F3F1B5.description: Combine manipulative, locomotor, and nonlocomotor skills into movement patterns.

6499B72ADBDB42BA94E448CAD2515575.description:
Demonstrate mature techniques for the following patterns: overhand, sidearm, and
underhand throwing; catching; kicking/punting; striking; trapping; dribbling (hand and foot); and volleying.

F408347482994F96BBE403DAD252C738.description:
Students demonstrate the motor skills and movement patterns needed
to perform a variety of physical activities.
